EnhancedContent:
During preview, thousands of users have leveraged created functions to embed their business logic into their Fabric ecosystem. We have seen sophisticated solutions for a wide variety of use cases from data engineering, with [Data pipelines](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-engineering/user-data-functions/create-functions-activity-data-pipelines) and [Notebooks](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-engineering/notebook-utilities#user-data-function-udf-utilities), to Translytical applications using [Power BI reports](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/translytical-task-flow-overview).

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/image-24-1024x541.png)Create, connect and run your business logic with User Data Functions

## Benefits of using User Data Functions

- Reusability: Create functions that can be used across different parts of your data architecture.
- Customization: Use Python and PyPI libraries to write powerful functions that are tailored to your needs.
- Encapsulation: Write code that abstracts complex processes into single function calls.
- External connectivity: Use your functions to make requests outside of Fabric or call your functions from external systems using their public endpoints.

## Key features of User Data Functions

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/video_1_edit.gif)Create and edit your functions using the in-browser tooling or the VS Code extensions.
- Create functions using your choice of the in-browser portal or pro-developer tools with [VS Code.](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-engineering/user-data-functions/create-user-data-functions-vs-code) Edit, test and publish your functions with [end-to-end functionality](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-engineering/user-data-functions/test-user-data-functions) with your tooling of choice.
- Connect your functions to your [Fabric data sources](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-engineering/user-data-functions/connect-to-data-sources), including Fabric SQL Database, Fabric Warehouse, Fabric Lakehouse and Mirrored databases.
- Run your functions from wherever you need them. You can use [Power BI reports](https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/translytical-task-flow-overview), Fabric [Data pipelines](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-engineering/user-data-functions/create-functions-activity-data-pipelines) or [Fabric Notebooks](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-engineering/notebook-utilities#user-data-function-udf-utilities). You can also use the public endpoint to [invoke your functions](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-engineering/user-data-functions/tutorial-invoke-from-python-app) from a client application of your choice.

## What’s new in General Availability?

- User Data Functions is now available for all tenants without the need to turn on the feature in the Admin portal.
- The[region availability](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/admin/region-availability)for User Data Functions has been expanded.
- Visual Studio Code extensions for [Microsoft Fabric](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=fabric.vscode-fabric) and [User Data Functions](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=fabric.vscode-fabric-functions) are Generally Available.
- The following features have been announced recently:
- Test your functions using [Develop mode](https://blog.fabric.microsoft.com/blog/test-and-validate-your-functions-with-develop-mode-in-fabric-user-data-functions-preview/).
- Generate an [OpenAPI specification](https://blog.fabric.microsoft.com/blog/openapi-specification-code-generation-now-available-in-fabric-user-data-functions/) for your functions.
- [Pandas and async functions](https://blog.fabric.microsoft.com/blog/user-data-functions-now-support-async-functions-and-pandas-dataframe-series-types) support.

Test capability in Develop mode is now available in all tenants with billing in audit mode. Please review the [Fabric operations documentation article](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/enterprise/fabric-operations#fabric-user-data-functions) to understand the billing implications for using this feature.
